In the course of her training, the girl meets a charming aristocrat who offers to support her in her sporting ambitions. This is, without a doubt, one of my favorite Columbo episodes ever. The acting is very well done, the music is very catchy, the script and dialogue are quite clever and witty, the camera work shows off various interesting angles and positions of the set, and the character of the serial killer leads to the most memorable final line!
Seriously, there are two final scenes very close to the end of the episode that are among the most iconic Columbo finale scenes and exchanges

Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. Centered on Miyazawa’s own life, the film depicts his adolescence through the evil schemes of the local agriculture cooperative and the ideological rule enforced by the military-backed puppet government in the harsh environment of a Hokkaido township hit by a severe famine.<|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|>

A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat. The townspeople are stopping what they can to hurt the creature, but it seems to just keep coming back, until they resort to one last choice.
